OpenSRA: Documentation for Developers¶

About¶

Open Seismic Risk Assessment Tool (OpenSRA) is an open-source software (OpenSRA Github page) licensed under Slate Geotechnical Consultants (Slate) and the Regents of the University of California. OpenSRA quantifies losses of gas pipelines, distribution lines, and transmission lines from earthquake scenarios in the form of decision variables, following the performance-based earthquake engineering (PBEE) framework from PEER (Deierlein et al., 2003).

Developers¶

  • Barry Zheng, PhD (Slate)

  • Steve Gavrilovic, PhD (NHERI SimCenter)

  • Maxime Lacour, PhD (UC Berkeley)

Contacts¶

  • Barry Zheng, PhD (Slate): http://slategeotech.com/people/

  • Jennie Watson-Lamprey, PhD (Slate): http://slategeotech.com/people/

Acknowledgements¶

  • Simon Kwong, PhD (USGS)
